article_title: Healthcare Inflation Reaches Six Decade Low--What Caused It? Will It Continue?

article_metadata.description: Health inflation is at a six decade low in absolute terms. But relative to general inflation we have seen two other times when "excess" health inflation has actually been lower than it is today. In both cases, "excess" health inflation quickly surged within a year or two to very high levels. No one hopes this will happen again, but there are some things to worry about. But even if we tame health inflation, this is no guarantee we have controlled health spending. Five-and-a-half years into Obamacare we still face the same excess growth in health spending as we did before Obamacare despite record low medical price inflation. If Obamacare is going to bend the cost curve, it still has a long way to go.
article_metadata.author: The Apothecary
